notes.note: resteasy-client: potential sensitive information leakage in JAX-RS RESTEasy Client's WebApplicationException handling

reference.description: bz#1879042: CVE-2020-25633 resteasy-client: potential sensitive information leakage in JAX-RS RESTEasy Client's WebApplicationException handling

remediation.description:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.
The References section of this erratum contains a download link for the update. You must be logged in to download the update.

notes.note: fabric8-kubernetes-client: vulnerable to a path traversal leading to integrity and availability compromise

reference.description: bz#1923405: CVE-2021-20218 fabric8-kubernetes-client: vulnerable to a path traversal leading to integrity and availability compromise

remediation.description:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

acknowledgment.description: This issue was discovered by Ivan Bodrov and Marc Nuri (Red Hat).

note:
An update is now available for Red Hat build of Quarkus.
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability. For more information, see the CVE links in the References section.

This release of Red Hat build of Quarkus 1.11.6 includes security updates, bug fixes, and enhancements. For more information, see the release notes page listed in the References section.
Security Fix(es):
* cron-utils: template injection allows attackers to inject arbitrary Java EL expressions leading to remote code execution (CVE-2020-26238)
* resteasy-client: potential sensitive information leakage in JAX-RS RESTEasy Client's WebApplicationException handling (CVE-2020-25633)
* fabric8-kubernetes-client: vulnerable to a path traversal leading to integrity and availability compromise (CVE-2021-20218)
* resteasy: information disclosure via HTTP response reuse (CVE-2020-25724)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgements, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
